2,3:
we'd prefer=we would prefer
因为prefer在这里是原型, 我们就知道we'd是we would而不是we had.

I'd prefer someone who's hardworking and reliable.

I'd prefer casual dining.

Young people would prefer low prices to large portions.
6,7,8,9:
pleasant=adj 令人愉快的
manner=n 行为 举止 [SINGULAR]
a way of behaving or speaking

with a pleasant manner=有令人愉快的举止

with a lovely view of the park
with long blonde hair
4,5:
presentable=可以present给别人看的, 看起来还不错的
good looking=长得好看的
注意区别二者.

someone presentable=的人, 就是长得还拿得出手.
我们从中学到了someone+adj的表达

Someone tall.
someone talented.

2,3,4:
come in for sth=来这里为某事

I only come in for the meetings.

I only come in when you need to fix your computers.

注意这里in和for两个词连用, 你可能觉得奇怪, 因为in是副词, 后边不需要接任何东西

好比我们说请进come in.
超车 cut in

6:
talent=人才 不可数
We need to hire more talent.
A company will only succeed if it has the talent.

talent=才干, 才能
I have a talent for music.
Anne has a talent for remembering things.
1,2,3,4,5:
organize=v 组织
organization=n 组织机构
organizer=n 组织者

What this organizaiton needs is...
我们从这个句子中可以提炼出如下用法
What sb needs is

What I need is my business cards.
What I need is some understanding.
注意既可以是具体的东西, 也可以是抽象的东西.

推而广之得到What I want/need/like is
What I want is some coffee.
What I like is some quietness.

4:
yet=表示转折
我们从句子中学到了yet+adj的用法

He's serious, yet adorable.

yet也可以后边跟其他结构来表示专业.

He's 26, yet he can't cook(跟一个句子)

3,4:
someone like.
我们学到了上边的这个用法

My ideal women is someone like Sherry.

I want someone like William.

1,2,3,4,5:
注意这句话完整的是
someone who can rollerblade, but who also likes to walk

后半句省略了who, 因为前半句已经出现了who

I want someone who can get the job done, but also knows how to have fun.

1,2,3:
high level=n&adj 高层, 高层的

This is a very high level meeting.

He's got some friends at high level

3:
guess=v 猜

guess what? CEO is coming tomorrow.
guess how I did this?
guess when Nina will be here?

从这里我们学到了 
guess+who/how/what/when...的用法
注意从句中的语序

guess when will Nina be here是错误的语序

4,5,6:
Chief Executive Officer=首席执行官
Chief Financial Officer=首席财务官
Chief Technology Officer=首席 技术官

C大头的表示公司最高一层的领导人

6:
roll=v 滚, 滚动
blade=n 刀片, 冰刀
rollerblade=v 溜旱冰

I love rollerblading.
I don't know how to rollerblade

3,4:
someone who+v
我们提炼出以上的用法, someone后边跟了一个从句

I want to hire someone who's serious yet cheerful.

My ideal man is someone who's dependable and sensitive.
6,7,8,9:
get the job done=把工作搞定
我们从中学到get sth v-ed的结构

get this fish grilled

get your room cleaned

3,4:
这是Sharon在Jim Bigelow的名字上玩的一个小游戏.
从Bigelow中拎出来Big.
Big本身又有重要的意思.

Tomorrow will be a big day for us.
I will have a big game tomorrow.
